intro: Camissoniopsis pallida, commonly known as the pale camissonia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces capsules as its fruit. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
